page.title: 15Gadgets or Necessities
page.content: Many people in 1985 set great store on possessing pieces of hardware which they regard as essential to modern life so we did a count over 108 homes to see who has what. 96% had colour T.V., 75% had an automatic washing machine, 24% owned a microwave oven, 53% of homes had a video recorder, only 3 families(2.7%) had a video camera, 74% owned at least one car, 69% had a telephone, deep freezers were in 84% of homes, just 4 homes(3.7%) contained a dishwasher, 59% had an automatic toaster and 50% had a toasted sandwich maker. Although home computers are relatively new 38% already have one but they are used mainly for playing games. We found out that 73% of these computers had been bought during the last year. We wonder what people will have in the year 2085?
